revision.text:
This is a '''list of [[demon]]s''' that appear in religion, theology, demonology, mythology, and folklore.<!-- most are attributed here to some Capitalized demonology, mythology, or folklore; most of which have articles at wikipedia (bluelinks in the Key: Sources named) --> It is not a list of names of demons,<!-- nor is it [[Names of the demons]] which seems to be Christian --> although some are listed by more than one name.<!-- greater clarity may be possible after reading the complex entries -->
The [[list of fictional demons]] includes those from literary fiction with theological aspirations, such as Dante's ''[[Inferno (Dante) |Inferno]]''.<!-- the main example Talked here --> Because numerous {{c|lists of legendary creatures}} concern mythology, folklore, and folk fairy tales, much overlap may be expected.
[[Names of God]], [[list of deities]], and [[list of deities in fiction]] concern God and gods.
==Key==
Each entry names a demon <!-- or demon species? all are proper nouns but may not refer to individuals --> and gives a source in parentheses.
;Sources named <!-- 2012-05-21 errorprone --> <u>[[Demonology]]</u>: [[Ayyavazhi demonology |Ayyavazhi]], [[Christian demonology |Christian]], [[Hindu demonology |Hindu]], [[Islamic demonology |Islamic]], [[Jewish demonology |Jewish]]
<u>[[Eschatology]]</u>: [[Islamic eschatology]]
<u>[[Folklore]]</u>: [[Bulgarian folklore |Bulgarian]], [[Christian folklore |Christian]], [[German folklore |German]], [[Jewish folklore |Jewish]]
<u>[[Mythology]]</u>: [[Akkadian mythology |Akkadian]], [[Babylonian mythology |Babylonian]], [[Buddhist mythology |Buddhist]], [[Chaldean mythology |Chaldean]], [[Christian mythology |Christian]], [[Egyptian mythology |Egyptian]], [[Etruscan mythology |Etruscan]], [[Finnish mythology |Finnish]], [[Greek mythology |Greek]], [[Guanche mythology |Guanche]], [[Hindu mythology |Hindu]], [[Indonesian mythology |Indonesia]], [[Irish mythology |Irish]], [[Japanese mythology |Japanese]], [[Mapuche mythology |Mapuche]], [[Moabite mythology |Moabite]], [[Native American mythology]],{{clarify|date=May 2012}} [[Persian mythology |Persian]], [[Phoenician mythology |Phoenician]], [[Slavic mythology |Slavic]], [[Semitic mythology |Semitic]], [[Sumerian mythology |Sumerian]]
* [[Gnosticism]], [[Hinduism]], [[Thelema]], [[Zoroastrianism]] * nautical folklore, [[Sanskrit]],{{clarify|date=May 2012}}, [[Testament of Solomon]]
{{compactTOC8|top=yes|seealso=yes|extlinks=yes}} Many demons have names with several spellings but few are listed under more than one spelling.
==A==
